Principles

Tips

Stop thinking about decorations, start thinking about the value.

The only thing that matters is the data your audience is came for. Design, layouts, make-up and decorations are just your tools to highlight the value.

Imagine you have 30 secs to pitch your data. What would you say? What decision maker need to know? How would you present it? What would you highlight? What would you hide?

That's it. That's the only thing that matters. Delete the noise. Make your audience satisfied.

Copy to Clipboard

js/copy-to-clipboard.js

v2.0.0 Stable (Changelog) | CDN (minified) | Download file_download

This isÂ aÂ small utility that adds aÂ â€œcopyâ€ content_copy icon next toÂ things people actually want toÂ copy. Links. Addresses. Code snippets. Anything.

Click the icon, the data goes toÂ the clipboard, the icon briefly turns into aÂ checkmark, everyone isÂ happy and moves on.

The script doesnâ€™t care about your layout, your CSS philosophy, orÂ how deeply nested your markupÂ is. ItÂ follows one simple rule: either you explicitly tell itÂ what toÂ copy, orÂ you place itÂ next toÂ something marked asÂ copyable.

Thatâ€™s the whole contract:

  • IfÂ the icon has data-copy-target, the script copies text from that element.
  • IfÂ not, itÂ looks for the nearest element marked with data-copy.
  • IfÂ that element isÂ aÂ link, itÂ copies theÂ URL. Otherwise, itÂ copies the text content.

NoÂ duplicated data. NoÂ hard-coded containers. NoÂ assumptions about structure. ItÂ works the same way onÂ documentation sites, dashboards, crypto wallets, and boring corporate pages.

This isÂ intentional. The script stays dumb. The HTML stays expressive.

Basic usage

Copy aÂ link (URL, not label)

<a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/script.min.js" data-copy>Copy Link</a>
<button class="copy-data-icon" title="Copy link" data-icon="content_copy"></button>

Clicking the icon copies the full CDN URL.

Check itÂ out: Copy Link

Copy plain text (addresses, hashes, IDs)

Works exactly like wallet address copy buttons. Because thatâ€™s what itÂ is.

Copy code from aÂ block

Use the .code-block wrapper and aÂ button with the copy-data-icon class toÂ create aÂ classic code block with aÂ copy button:

Use data-copy-target when proximity isÂ not enough orÂ would beÂ ambiguous.

JavaScript

Include once per page:

const ICON_DEFAULT = "content_copy";
const ICON_SUCCESS = "check";
const RESET_MS = 1200;

function getCopyText(icon) {
  if (icon.dataset.copyTarget) {
    const target = document.querySelector(icon.dataset.copyTarget);
    return target?.textContent?.trim() || "";
  }

  const source =
    icon.closest("[data-copy]") ||
    icon.parentElement?.querySelector("[data-copy]");

  if (!source) return "";
  return source.getAttribute("href") || source.textContent.trim();
}

function fallbackCopy(text) {
  const ta = document.createElement("textarea");
  ta.value = text;
  ta.style.position = "fixed";
  ta.style.opacity = "0";
  ta.style.pointerEvents = "none";
  document.body.appendChild(ta);
  ta.select();
  const ok = document.execCommand("copy");
  ta.remove();
  return ok;
}

document.addEventListener("click", async (e) => {
  const icon = e.target.closest(".copy-data-icon");
  if (!icon) return;

  if (icon.dataset.copyBusy) return;

  const text = getCopyText(icon);
  if (!text) return;

  icon.dataset.copyBusy = "1";

  const showSuccess = () => {
    icon.dataset.icon = ICON_SUCCESS;
    clearTimeout(icon._copyTimer);
    icon._copyTimer = setTimeout(() => {
      icon.dataset.icon = ICON_DEFAULT;
      delete icon.dataset.copyBusy;
    }, RESET_MS);
  };

  try {
    await navigator.clipboard.writeText(text);
    showSuccess();
  } catch {
    if (fallbackCopy(text)) showSuccess();
    else delete icon.dataset.copyBusy;
  }
});

Including the script

Donâ€™t forget toÂ actually include the script onÂ the page. Icons donâ€™t copy things byÂ positive thinking alone.

You can either host the file locally orÂ load itÂ from aÂ CDN. Both options work the sameÂ way.

// Local file:
<script src="/js/copy-to-clipboard.min.js"></script>

// CDN:
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/raredigits/rare-scripts@v2.0.0/copy-to-clipboard/copy-to-clipboard.min.js"></script>

Include itÂ once per page, preferably near the end ofÂ the document orÂ with defer.

Styling

Make it feel clickable, not decorative:

.copy-data-icon {
    display: inline-block;
    font-family: "Material Symbols Outlined";
    font-size: var(--font-size-lg);
    position: relative;
    top: 0.2em;
    font-size: inherit;
    line-height: inherit;
    background: none;
    color: var(--text-color-light);
    border: none;
    padding: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
}

.copy-data-icon::before {
    content: attr(data-icon);
}

.copy-data-icon:hover {
    color: var(--primary-color);
    background: none;
    border: none;
}

Design principles (why this wonâ€™t rot):

  • The script does not depend onÂ layout.
  • HTML owns the meaning. JavaScript only moves data.
  • NoÂ duplicated content inÂ attributes.
  • Works with links, text, code, addresses.
  • Scales from one icon toÂ hundreds without extra listeners.

IfÂ anÂ element should beÂ copied, mark itÂ with data-copy.
IfÂ the icon should copy something specific, tell itÂ where with data-copy-target.

Everything else isÂ none ofÂ the scriptâ€™s business.
